page.title: 08CHELMSFORD POLICE
page.content: Some 75 Police Officers are stationed in Chelmsford (55 men and 20 women). The{Police Station}is situated on the corner of{Victoria Road}and{New {Street.}The officers work a shift system of eight hours each and a Police Constable's salary starts at around Â£10,000 a year. The Traffic Division officers use cars, vans and motorcycles to patrol the network of roads around Chelmsford and ordinary uniformed officers patrol on foot or use cars to reach the scene of incidents more quickly. There is a network of{Community Police {officers}around the Chelmsford area to liaise with local householders, businesses and schoolchildren. On duty,a uniformed officer carries a small two-way radio,notebook,handcuffs and a wooden truncheon (concealed in a special trouser-pocket).
